title: PIG-5414 Fix the build for Linux ARM64
body:
More and more software deployment and deployment is being done on ARM64 CPU architecture.
It would be good if Apache Pig is being regularly tested on ARM64.

https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/PIG/HowToContribute mentions Jenkins job (https://builds.apache.org/job/Pig-trunk-commit) but it seems it got lost at some point.

Update Snappy because the old version does not provide native library for aarch64 (ARM64).
Update Avro to 1.8.2 because otherwise TestAvroStorage and TestOrcStorage tests fail on Linux ARM64.
Add TravisCI build config to run the build on Linux ARM64.

PIG-4940: Fix predicate push-down Unary expressions.
body:
Rather than assuming any child expression of `IsNullExpression` and
`NotExpression` can be pushed down, this calls `checkPushDown` on the child
and will push the entire expression if and only if the entire child can
be pushed.

title: Fix typo in JsonLoader field number mismatch warning
body: Fixes typo in `Early termination of record, expected 11 fields bug found 6` to `... but found` instead of `... bug found`.

title: Providing an empty option name is invalid
body:
Option is valided by https://github.com/apache/commons-cli/blob/trunk/src/main/java/org/apache/commons/cli/Option.java#L146
that is checked against Character.isJavaIdentifierPart https://github.com/apache/commons-cli/blob/trunk/src/main/java/org/apache/commons/cli/OptionValidator.java#L97

I see no point providing initially an empty opt name, therefore I assumed it was a typo.

title: Fixed the 'new line' character inside double-quote causing the csv pa…
body:
A new line character should be allowed inside a double quote as a valid csv document.  For example, the following csv document should be treated as a SINGLE valid csv data

Iphone,"{ ItemName : Cheez-It
21 Ounce}",

However, the current implementation of the getNext() inside org.apache.pig.piggybank.storage.CSVLoader class fails to take care of this case and it sees two lines of data while in fact it should be treated as single line of data.

This pull request fixes the above issue.

(Note: here is a linke to validate whether a csv document:  http://csvlint.io/)

Here is a KafkaStorage function that export data from pig to Kafka in JSON format. I have used the libreries from http://mvnrepository.com:
<dependency>
    <groupId>org.apache.kafka</groupId>
    <artifactId>kafka_2.10</artifactId>
    <version>0.8.2.0</version>
</dependency>

<dependency>
    <groupId>org.json</groupId>
    <artifactId>json</artifactId>
    <version>20140107</version>
</dependency>

title: (branch-0.14) XPath allow to ignore namespace and add XPathAll support
body:
Folks,
#1

We have added a parameter to XPath to have it ignore any namespace directives in the xpath command.    This is very helpful when you are cut/pasting xpaths from tools that automatically include the namespace information.    The existing implementation can not handle namespaces so it fails to match, and manually removing the namespace information is tedious and errorprone.
#2

We have added an XPathAll UDF which will return all of the xpath matches as an array.    This can be used to extract multiple items and flatten them for further processing.    We tried to mimic the existing *All pattern from other UDF's.
## 

John Cavanaugh
